page.description: Capitalizes the first letter of each word in a string and removes all leading and trailing whitespace.
page.prototype: Output_String as C = wut(string as C)
page.discussion: The WUT() function is a convenience function that can be used in place of calling w_upper() and alltrim() on a string. It capitalizes the initial letter of each word in a string and removes all leading and training spaces.
page.example: ? wut(" Now is the time ") = "Now Is The Time"
